definitions.text: remote and separate physically or socially; ; - W.H.Hudson
examples: existed over the centuries as a world apart
preserved because they inhabited a place apart
tiny isolated villages remote from centers of civilization
an obscure village

definitions.text: having characteristics not shared by others; - Vannever Bush
examples: scientists felt they were a group apart

definitions.text: separated or at a distance in place or position or time
examples: These towns are many miles apart
stood with his legs apart
born two years apart

definitions.text: not taken into account or excluded from consideration
examples: these problems apart, the country is doing well
all joking aside, I think you're crazy
they grew apart over the years
kept apart from the group out of shyness
decided to live apart

definitions.text: placed or kept separate and distinct as for a purpose
examples: had a feeling of being set apart
quality sets it apart
a day set aside for relaxing
people can't tell the twins apart
he took his father's watch apart
split apart
torn asunder
